Routine Butler:
In this project, Sonny built an impressive RaspberryPi contraption that locks his phone away and serves him customizable routine sequences via a kiosk. He's been using it for months and always brings it home when he visits.

Here is a very hastily slapped-together video he made to explain more. He hopes to improve this explanation video in the future.

You can also check out the code for this project. I would especially recommend checking out a few of the automated tests!
Rick & Morty Speaker Attribution:
In this project, Sonny demonstrates how a handful of coding tricks, like the strategy pattern, can be used to better perform and track modeling experiments.

You can check out the code and writeup for this project here.

You can also explore the experiment results and feed your own text to the model with this Streamlit app.
